required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Benefits of Hemp Protein Supplementation During Resistance Training
clinical_study.official_title: The Benefits of Hemp Protein Supplementation During Resistance Training

brief_summary.textblock: Forty physically active men and women aged 18-45y will take part in an 8-week resistance training program, randomized (double blind) 1:1 into each of two groups. Twenty participants will be randomized to receive 60 g/d of hemp powder (containing approximately 40 g protein and 9 g oil) supplementation and 20 randomized to receive 60 g/d of soy supplementation (matched to the hemp for macronutrients and calories) during eight weeks of training. Each participant will complete testing before and after the intervention for assessment of body composition (lean tissue, fat, and bone mass), strength, central fatigue, markers of inflammation, and bone resorption. Over the 8-weeks of training, participants will train four-five days per week for 1-1.5 hours per session with exercises targeting all major muscle groups. The training will involve a "two day split" where different muscle groups are trained on two consecutive days (day 1 involves chest, back, and arms; day 2 legs, shoulders, and abdominals). Resistance training will provide the necessary stimulus for protein synthesis to optimize the effect of a protein-containing nutritional supplement. The hemp or soy powder will be consumed in two doses (i.e. 30 g powder containing 20 g protein per dose) immediately after exercise sessions and one hour after exercise. This dosing regimen is optimal for stimulating muscle protein synthesis and building muscle mass . On the one non-training day per week the two doses will be consumed with meals.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Lean tissue mass measured with dual energy x-ray absrorptiometry

secondary_outcome.description: Fat mass as measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry
Bone mass as measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in elbow flexor muscle thickness (cm)
secondary_outcome.description: Muscle thickness as assessed by ultrasound

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in knee extensor muscle thickness (cm)
secondary_outcome.description: muscle thickness as measured by ultrasound
Bench press strength as assess on a plate-loaded machine by the 1-RM method
Arm curl strength as assessed with dumbbells by the 1-RM method
Leg press strength as assessed on a leg-press machine by the 1-RM method

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in inflammation by interleukin-6 (mmol/l) levels
secondary_outcome.description: Interleukin-6 levels measured from saliva samples

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in inflammation by C-reactive protein (mmol/l) levels
secondary_outcome.description: C-reactive protein levels measured from saliva samples
Voluntary muscle activation as measured by the interpolated twitch technique

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 6 months experience with resistance training
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergies to hemp or soy
- Consumption of other nutritional supplements in previous month
- Answered "yes" to questions on the Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire
